metadata.title: CVE-2023-4046 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In some circumstances, a stale value could have been used for a globalvariable in WASM JIT analysis. This resulted in incorrect compilation and apotentially exploitable crash in the content process. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 116, Firefox ESR < 102.14, and Firefox ESR < 115.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4046` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.15.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs102 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.15.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
